oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Regulatory Science and Regulatory Affairs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Molins, Ricardo
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Regulatory science is a relatively new field of study and practice, brought about by the need to develop and apply tools and guidelines designed to give laws and regulations a solid scientific basis. Without a scientific basis, guidelines, laws, regulations, and standards would hardly be objective and able to withstand the scrutiny and opposition that they often generate.https://doi.org/10.21423/jrs-v05n02pi (DOI assigned 3/11/2019)
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Office of the Texas State Chemist
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Journal of Regulatory Science; Vol 5, No 2 (2017); i-ii
